correction_response: This tweet is partially accurate. It's true that Marjorie Taylor Greene had $183,504 in PPP loans forgiven (https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/white-house-shines-light-republicans-are-criticizing-student-debt-canc-rcna44904). However, the claim about Joel Osteen is misleading. His church did receive a PPP loan, but it was fully repaid (https://www.nydailynews.com/2021/10/10/multimillionaire-joel-osteens-lakewood-church-returns-44-million-in-ppp-loans/). The tweet doesn't provide sources for the claims about Lauren Boebert and Tom Brady. It's important to note that PPP loans were intended to help businesses keep employees on payroll during the pandemic and could be forgiven if certain conditions were met (https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/white-house/white-house-shines-light-republicans-are-criticizing-student-debt-canc-rcna44904).
note_1_text: The $4.4 million for Lakewood Church where Osteen is pastor went to support the salary and benefits of approximately 350 employees. Neither Osteen nor his wife directly benefited. After criticism, the church is repaying the loan.    https://nypost.com/2021/10/10/joel-osteens-lakewood-church-to-repay-4-4m-in-ppp-loans/
note_2_text: Loans under the Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) were designed to be forgivable if recipients met certain requirements (including maintaining pre-loan employment numbers and spending proceeds on payroll).    https://www.sba.gov/funding-programs/loans/covid-19-relief-options/paycheck-protection-program/ppp-loan-forgiveness
